cab.content: 'This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majestyfs Government.)Circulated by the Secretary of State for India.Ooloaer Jones 1 ^ / From Viceroy, 25th February 1918. (Received 26th February, 10.30 a.m.) Secret. Weekly report. North-West Frontier quiet. Baluchistan. Seemy telegram of 21st February. Gumbaz was attacked fey 3,000 Maris, andsmall, party broke into fort, garrison of which was 25 police and 75 sowars.McConaghey is in Gurnbaz and telegraphed on 21st that attack had not beenrenewed. Kohlu vacated, all. officials, rifles and cartridges reached Barkhansafely. Agent to Governor-General is being authorised invite surrender oftribe and their submission to settlement byjirga representative sardars ofwhole Baluchistan before worse befalls them. Meanwhile troops are pro-ceeding Harnai, aeroplanes are at Sibf, and preparations are being made incase advance into Mari country should be unavoidable. No change in general military situation.
